actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

official_title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to lower the maximum Federal medical assistance percentage that may be applied with respect to any State under the medicaid program and to increase such percentage with respect to all States under such program.

summary.text: Medicaid Equalization Act of 1994 - Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to: (1) reduce the maximum Federal medical assistance percentage for a State from 83 percent to 60 percent; and (2) increase by 1.2 percentage points the medical assistance percentage for all States.

titles.title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to lower the maximum Federal medical assistance percentage that may be applied with respect to any State under the medicaid program and to increase such percentage with respect to all States under such program.
